p: The 1,001 PLWH who were alive 3 years after release ( n = 93 died) were demographically similar to the overall sample, and 41.5% of PLWH met criteria for sustained RIC ( Table 2). In the final model, sustained RIC was independently associated with older age (>45 years), having health insurance, being re-incarcerated for >90 days during follow-up, receiving >30 case management visits, and being linked to care or re-incarcerated within 14 days after initial release. VS prior to release was not independently associated with RIC, although not having a VL measured prior to release was negatively associated with RIC.
